spanishExample: ¡No mueras! ¡Aún tienes mi dinero!
englishTranslation: Don’t die! You still have my money!

spanishExample: Creo que entiende lo que tiene que hacer si yo muero.
englishTranslation: I think he understands what he has to do if I die.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
entiende: understands, he/she/it understands (Entender, present, 3rd person)
muero: die, I die (Morir, present, 1st person)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Él quiere que yo entienda que ella no murió.
englishTranslation: He wants me to understand that she didn’t die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entienda: understand, I understand (Entender, subjunctive, 1st person)
murió: died , he/she/it died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Entendemos que es solo un sueño, no es una maldición de verdad.
englishTranslation: We understand it’s just a dream, it’s not a curse really.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendemos: understand, we understand (Entender, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Entendió que había doce, pero en verdad había quince.
englishTranslation: He understood there were twelve, but actually there were fifteen.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendió: understood, he/she/it understood (Entender, preterite, 3rd person)
había: "there was/were" indicating existence (Haber, imperfect, impersonal)

spanishExample: Éramos once personas en el juego, pero no morimos.
englishTranslation: We were eleven people in the game, but we didn’t die.
vocabIncluded: morimos: died, we died (Morir, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: La falta de dinero será un problema si te mueres.
englishTranslation: The lack of money will be a problem if you die.
vocabIncluded: morirse: any use of morir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to die)
mueres: die, you die (Morir, present, 2nd person)
será: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Ser, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Le hacía falta dinero en mi sueño.
englishTranslation: He was in need of money in my dream.
vocabIncluded: hacía: "was doing/making", "I was doing/making" (Hacer, imperfect, 1st person)
le hace falta: in need of something (idiom)

spanishExample: No entendí la orden.
englishTranslation: I didn’t understand the order.
vocabIncluded: entendí: understood, I understood (Entender, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: No entendiste que podrías morir.
englishTranslation: You didn’t understand that you could die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendiste: understood, you understood (Entender, preterite, 2nd person)
podrías: "would be able", "you would be able" (Poder, conditional, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No entiendes que puede que yo muera.
englishTranslation: You don’t understand that it might be that I die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendes: understand, you understand (Entender, present, 2nd person)
muera: die, I die (Morir, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: No me entienden, cuatro personas murieron.
englishTranslation: You(plural) don’t understand me; four people died.
vocabIncluded: entienden: understand, they understand (Entender, present, 3rd person plural)
murieron: died, they died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No puedo entender el número catorce.
englishTranslation: I can’t understand number fourteen.

spanishExample: No quiero que muera, porque si muere estaré triste.
englishTranslation: I don’t want him to die, because if he dies I’ll be sad.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
estaré: "will be", "I will be" (Estar, future, 1st person)
muera: die, he/she/it die (Morir, subjunctive, 3rd person)
muere: dies, he/she/it dies (Morir, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No quiero que mueras por la falta de agua.
englishTranslation: I don’t want you to die because of the lack of water.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
mueras: die, you die (Morir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que entienda que a ella le hacen falta trece dólares.
englishTranslation: I want him to understand that she is in need of thirteen dollars.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a, used in a "redundant indirect object", e.g. le hice un favor a la chica
entienda: understand, he/she/it understand (Entender, subjunctive, 3rd person)
le hace falta: in need of something (idiom)

spanishExample: Si morimos es por la maldición.
englishTranslation: If we die it’s because of the curse.
vocabIncluded: morimos: die, we die (Morir, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Si tienes uno más, tendrás catorce y no trece, entonces es una orden.
englishTranslation: If you have one more, you’ll have fourteen and not thirteen, so it’s an order.
vocabIncluded: tendrás: "will have", "you will have" (Tener, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Son las doce en punto y mi teléfono está muriendo.
englishTranslation: It’s twelve o’clock and my phone is dying.

spanishExample: Ya entiendo, cinco por tres es igual a quince.
englishTranslation: Now I understand, five times three equals fifteen.
vocabIncluded: entiendo: understand, I understand (Entender, present, 1st person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things
